title: How to Make Raisin Biscuits

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description: Set the oven to 220 °C (428 °F) before beginning the biscuits.

steps.headline: Mix the flour, salt, sugar, baking powder, raisins and rosemary.
steps.description: In a large bowl, mix the flour, salt, sugar, baking powder, rosemary, and the raisins. Combine well, either with a spoon or by hand.

steps.headline: Add the butter.
steps.description: Add cold butter and with your hands and combine it well with all the ingredients until the mix resembles the consistency of wet sand.

steps.headline: Add the milk and mix together.
steps.description:
Pour 2/3 of the milk into the mixture and continue to mix with your hands until the dough becomes uniform. Be careful not to over-mix or the biscuits will be come tough and stringy instead of light and flaky. Dough should be slightly tacky to touch but not too dry. If too dry, add a bit more of the milk. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid546754-v4-728px-Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Roll out and cut.
steps.description:
Sprinkle a little flour on the working surface. Lay out dough, sprinkle a little more flour on top and with a rolling pin, roll it out to about a one centimetre thickness. Be sure not to work the dough too much. Now, using a small drinking glass or cookie cutter, cut circles of dough until no more circles can be cut. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid546754-v4-728px-Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Put the biscuits into the baking sheet.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, remove from heat, and serve.
steps.description: After ten to fifteen minutes, take the biscuits from the oven. They should have a golden brown complexion. The biscuits are best served hot and go well with butter, marmalade, or jam. If you want a taste of the savoury, serve with ham or cheese.

text:
Preheat the oven. Set the oven to 220 °C (428 °F) before beginning the biscuits. Mix the flour, salt, sugar, baking powder, raisins and rosemary. In a large bowl, mix the flour, salt, sugar, baking powder, rosemary, and the raisins. Combine well, either with a spoon or by hand. Add the butter. Add cold butter and with your hands and combine it well with all the ingredients until the mix resembles the consistency of wet sand. Add the milk and mix together. Pour 2/3 of the milk into the mixture and continue to mix with your hands until the dough becomes uniform. Be careful not to over-mix or the biscuits will be come tough and stringy instead of light and flaky. Dough should be slightly tacky to touch but not too dry. If too dry, add a bit more of the milk. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid546754-v4-728px-Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Roll out and cut. Sprinkle a little flour on the working surface. Lay out dough, sprinkle a little more flour on top and with a rolling pin, roll it out to about a one centimetre thickness. Be sure not to work the dough too much. Now, using a small drinking glass or cookie cutter, cut circles of dough until no more circles can be cut. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid546754-v4-728px-Make-Raisin-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Put the biscuits into the baking sheet. Bake for 10-15 minutes, remove from heat, and serve. After ten to fifteen minutes, take the biscuits from the oven. They should have a golden brown complexion. The biscuits are best served hot and go well with butter, marmalade, or jam. If you want a taste of the savoury, serve with ham or cheese. Finished.
